page.title: 04Edlingham Village & Environs
page.content: There is no shop, Post Office or village hall in this hamlet, only a handful of houses, some 15 in all. Of these, four have been built in the last 2 to 8 years. All are of stone or stone-faced; 6 are farm cottages of Victorian vintage. There is a large old vicarage now in private hands, 1 farmhouse, a detached farm cottage, an old blacksmiths cottage and forge, now turned into a retirement cottage and down the hill by the stream, a converted old mill cottage, modernised for present day living. The outlying farmhouses are all traditional stone with slate roofs. Public transport consists of 1 daily Post Bus from Whittingham to Alnwick. There is 1 C.E. church. There are travelling grocery, greengrocery and fish shops, also a mobile library.
